body_content.explanation: (of shares, bonds, etc.) able to be exchanged for cash at a particular time:
examples: An increasing number of listed companies are issuing redeemable shares.
Anglian has decided to issue shareholders with redeemable shares rather than dividends.
The 9% unsecured loan stock was redeemable at par on 31 May 2020.

body_content.explanation: (of a coupon, voucher, etc.) able to be exchanged for a particular amount of money or for goods of this value:
examples: Vouchers are redeemable until Thursday, June 25.
These points will be redeemable at more than 60 stores.
The points are only redeemable against future travel spending on the card.

body_content.explanation: (of an amount of money) able to be used to pay part of the cost of something :
examples: Tickets to the event are £5, redeemable against a purchase of the book on the night.

body_content.explanation: able to be corrected, improved, or changed:
examples: There are not a lot of redeemable qualities about this man.
"Even ministers currently doing Satan's work are potentially redeemable", he states.
